form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Cornyn (for himself, Mrs. Britt, Mr. Budd, Mr. Justice, and Mr. Scott of South Carolina) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend title 18, United States Code, to assert jurisdiction over murders committed by certain inadmissible or deportable aliens.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Justice for Victims of Illegal Alien Murders Act.

section.header: Murders committed by certain inadmissible or deportable aliens
section.text: Section 1111 of title 18, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:

subsection.text: Within any jurisdiction of the United States (whether or not in the special maritime and territorial jurisdiction of the United States), an alien who—

subparagraph.text: inadmissible under paragraph (6)(A), (6)(C), or (7) of section 212(a) of the Immigration and Nationality Act (8 U.S.C. 1182(a)); or
deportable under subparagraph (B) or (C)(i) of section 237(a)(1) of such Act (8 U.S.C. 1227(a)(1)); and
murder in the first degree, shall be punished by death or by imprisonment for life; or
murder in the second degree, shall be imprisoned for any term of years or for life.
